biography.value:
Once a mighty angel charged with watching the tides of the Blood War, Zariel succumbed to the corrupting influence of the Nine Hells and fell from grace. Asmodeus admired Zariel’s passion for war and offered her rulership of Avernus. She accepted his offer, and he transformed her into an archdevil.

Zariel’s rise in status came at the expense of Bel, her pit fiend predecessor. Zariel and Bel hate each other. To keep Bel busy and out of her sight, Zariel tasks him with forging weapons, armor, and gruesome demon-slaying machines.

To replenish her legions, Zariel needs the souls of mortals to create lemure;lemures, which she can then promote to higher forms of devils. She is keenly interested in collecting souls from the greatest warriors on the Material Plane. She bargains hard, and there is little hope of wriggling out of a pact. However, she expects the best from her servants, so she allows her mortal followers to live out their lives provided they continue to hone their talents to increase their value. As a result, Zariel’s servants are universally effective, disciplined, and dangerous.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Zariel makes three Flail or Longsword attacks. She can replace one attack with a use of Horrid Touch, if available.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=force average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 8d8 type=fire average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=radiant average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 2d10 + @mod type=radiant average=true]] damage when used with two hands, plus [[/damage 8d8 type=fire average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Zariel touches one creature within 10 feet of her. The target must succeed on a [[/save con 26 format=long]] or take [[/damage 8d10 type=necrotic average=true]] damage and be &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} for 1 minute. While &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} in this way, the target is &Reference[blinded]{blinded} and &Reference[deafened]{deafened}. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Zariel casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[cha]{Charisma} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 26):

At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing her appearance), detect evil and good, fireball, invisibility (self only), major image, wall of &Reference[fire]{fire}

3/day each: blade barrier, dispel evil and good, finger of death

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Zariel teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Zariel can take one of the following lair actions; she can’t take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

Fireball. Zariel casts the fireball spell.

Infernal Illusions. Zariel casts the major image spell four times, targeting different areas with it. Zariel prefers to create images of intruders’ loved ones being burned alive. Zariel doesn’t need to concentrate on the spells, which end on initiative count 20 of the next round. Each creature that can see these illusions must succeed on a [[/save wis 26 format=long]] or become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} of the &Reference[ill]{illusion} for 1 minute. A &Reference[frightened]{frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Regional Effects

The region containing Zariel’s lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

Hellscape. The area within 9 miles of the lair is filled with screaming voices and the stench of burning meat.

Pyres. Once every 60 feet within 1 mile of the lair, 10-foot-high gouts of flame rise from the ground. Any creature or object that touches the flame takes [[/damage 2d6 type=fire average=true]] damage, though it can take this damage no more than once per round.

Smoke. The area within 2 miles of the lair, but no closer than 500 feet, is filled with smoke, which causes the area to be heavily obscured. The smoke can’t be cleared away.

If Zariel dies, these effects fade over the course of 1d10 days.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Zariel’s Lair

Zariel makes her lair in a basalt citadel that rises up in Avernus. From nearly a mile away, one can hear the screams coming from burned victims chained to the stronghold’s wall—the dying remains of those who failed to impress the archdevil. The stronghold, covering five square miles, is surrounded by walls reinforced with high turrets. Devils of all kinds crawl over the structure, ensuring that no intruders breach their defenses.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Cultists of Zariel

Zariel grants special abilities to her most loyal cultists. They can gain the Ferocious Surge trait, and her cult’s leaders can also gain the Infernal Tactics trait.

Ferocious Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). When this creature hits with an attack roll that isn’t a critical hit, it can turn the hit into a critical hit.

Infernal Tactics. Immediately after rolling initiative, this creature can choose itself and up to three allies it can see if it isn’t &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated}. It can swap the initiative results of the chosen creatures among them.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Zariel teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Zariel can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Zariel regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

Teleport. Zariel uses Teleport.

Immolating Gaze (Costs 2 Actions). Zariel turns her magical gaze toward one creature she can see within 120 feet of her and commands it to burn. The target must succeed on a [[/save wis 26 format=long]] or take [[/damage 4d10 type=fire average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Zariel turns her magical gaze toward one creature she can see within 120 feet of her and commands it to burn. The target must succeed on a [[/save wis 26 format=long]] or take [[/damage 4d10 type=fire average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Devil’s Sight. Magical darkness doesn’t impede Zariel’s &Reference[darkvision]{darkvision}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If Zariel fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Magic Resistance. Zariel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Regeneration. Zariel regains [[/damage 20 type=heal average=false]] hit points at the start of her turn. If she takes &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of her next turn. Zariel dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Special Notes: can become Medium when changing her appearance.

You assume a different form. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following options, the effects of which last for the duration of the spell. While the spell lasts, you can end one option as an action to gain the benefits of a different one.

Aquatic Adaptation. You adapt your body to an aquatic environment, sprouting gills and growing webbing between your fingers. You can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Change Appearance. You transform your appearance. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this spell to become quadrupedal, for instance. At any time for the duration of the spell, you can use your action to change your appearance in this way again.

Natural Weapons. You grow claws, fangs, spines, horns, or a different natural weapon of your choice. Your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning}, &Reference[piercing]{piercing}, or &Reference[slashing]{slashing} damage, as appropriate to the natural weapon you chose, and you are proficient with your unarmed strikes. Finally, the natural weapon is magic and you have a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls you make using it.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

items.name: Alter Self (can become Medium when changing her appearance)

description.value:
For the duration, you know if there is an &Reference[aberration]{aberration}, &Reference[celestial]{celestial}, &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, &Reference[fey]{fey}, &Reference[fiend]{fiend}, or &Reference[undead]{undead} within 30 feet of you, as well as where the creature is located. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been magically consecrated or desecrated.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

description.value:
A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on that point must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. A target takes 8d6 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The &Reference[fire]{fire} spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

description.value:
Special Notes: self only.

A creature you touch becomes &Reference[invisible]{invisible} until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is &Reference[invisible]{invisible} as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

description.value:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems completely real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted. You can't create sufficient heat or &Reference[cold]{cold} to cause damage, a sound loud enough to deal &Reference[thunder]{thunder} damage or deafen a creature, or a smell that might sicken a creature (like a troglodyte's stench).

As long as you are within range of the &Reference[ill]{illusion}, you can use your action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the &Reference[ill]{illusion} to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an &Reference[ill]{illusion}, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an &Reference[ill]{illusion} with a successful &Reference[int]{Intelligence} (&Reference[inv]{Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the &Reference[ill]{illusion} for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring your &Reference[concentration]{concentration}.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

description.value:
You create a wall of &Reference[fire]{fire} on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d8 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals 5d8 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The other side of the wall deals no damage.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

description.value:
You create a vertical wall of whirling, razor-sharp blades made of magical energy. The wall appears within range and lasts for the duration. You can make a straight wall up to 100 feet long, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick, or a ringed wall up to 60 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick. The wall provides three-quarters cover to creatures behind it, and its space is difficult terrain.

When a creature enters the wall's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 6d10 &Reference[slashing]{slashing} damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

description.value:
Shimmering energy surrounds and protects you from &Reference[fey]{fey}, &Reference[undead]{undead}, and creatures originating from beyond the &Reference[material]{Material} Plane. For the duration, celestials, elementals, &Reference[fey]{fey}, fiends, and &Reference[undead]{undead} have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

You can end the spell early by using either of the following special functions.

Break &Reference[enc]{Enchantment}. As your action, you touch a creature you can reach that is &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, or possessed by a &Reference[celestial]{celestial}, an &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, a &Reference[fey]{fey}, a &Reference[fiend]{fiend}, or an &Reference[undead]{undead}. The creature you touch is no longer &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, or possessed by such creatures.

Dismissal. As your action, make a melee spell attack against a &Reference[celestial]{celestial}, an &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, a &Reference[fey]{fey}, a &Reference[fiend]{fiend}, or an &Reference[undead]{undead} you can reach. On a hit, you attempt to drive the creature back to its home plane. The creature must succeed on a &Reference[cha]{Charisma} saving throw or be sent back to its home plane (if it isn't there already). If they aren't on their home plane, &Reference[undead]{undead} are sent to the Shadowfell, and &Reference[fey]{fey} are sent to the Feywild.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

description.value:
You send negative energy coursing through a creature that you can see within range, causing it searing pain. The target must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. It takes 7d8 + 30 &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} killed by this spell rises at the start of your next turn as a zombie that is permanently under your command, following your &Reference[vocal]{verbal} orders to the best of its ability.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

atwill: alter self (can become Medium when changing her appearance)

edgeCases.name: alter self
edgeCases.edge: can become Medium when changing her appearance
